item.title: Does Helldivers 2 Have Cross-Progression on Xbox, PlayStation & PC? Cross-Platform Status Explained
item.content:encoded:
Hell may not have frozen over, but the release of Helldivers 2 on Xbox Series X|S is rapidly approaching and shows that nothing can be ruled out. If you want to know whether the release on the platform includes cross-progression, we‚Äôve got all the details you need.

Due to be released on Xbox on August 26, though there are no plans to bring the title to the Game Pass service, Arrowhead Games‚Äô title is one of the biggest releases of the summer for the platform and shows a major shift in approach from Sony, which published the title.

If you‚Äôve already played Helldivers 2 on PC or PlayStation and want to know whether you can transfer your progress and any unlocked content to a different platform, like Xbox, we‚Äôve got a full explanation on the feature.

Does Helldivers 2 Have Cross-Progression?

No, Helldivers 2 does not support cross-progression between platforms, and any unlocked content is only available on the existing version.

An FAQ published by Arrowhead in July, it was confirmed that any progression, including limited-time content, cannot be transferred between accounts. It was also confirmed that accounts cannot be merged.

This means, for example, that Xbox players will not be able to show off any content from earlier seasons in Helldivers 2, with any unlocks before the Xbox release being unavailable on the platform. However, you also can‚Äôt share your account between PlayStation and PC either.

Although cross-progression is unavailable, crossplay support is offered between PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S, so you can play with friends regardless of their platform.

Will Cross-Progression be Added to Helldivers 2?

It is unlikely that cross-progression will be added to Helldivers 2, as Arrowhead stated there are ‚Äúno plans to implement cross-progression at this time.‚Äù

While you can never say never, it‚Äôs clear that cross-progression is not a priority for the development team, and if the stance were to change, it would likely take a lengthy amount of time for the feature to be implemented.

There could be additional demand for cross-progression following the launch of Helldivers 2 on Xbox Series X|S, particularly as many players may have opted to purchase the game on PS5 or PC due to the previous unavailability on Xbox.

Do you want to see cross-progression added to Helldivers 2? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Helldivers news, check out a tease of Halo 3: ODST content for the game, and read about the developers‚Äô aims to make the game more challenging.

item.title: Will There be Another Battlefield 6 Open Beta?
item.content:encoded:
The Battlefield 6 community is now without BF6 content again. Two weekends of betas have seen you all rack up millions of eliminations, building destructions, and more. So let‚Äôs see if EA and Battlefield Studios are planning another Battlefield 6 beta before the game‚Äôs release window.

Battlefield Labs was a limited testing phase for BF6. Early indicators were good, but all this did was make the BF community feverish to try it out for itself. The first chance arrived with the Early Access Open Beta. Another couple of days passed, and it was time for worldwide destruction.

This couldn‚Äôt have been more fitting as the BF6 beta destroyed all expectations, the game blew up, and Battlefield 6 destroyed CoD with over 500,000 concurrent players in the betas. With the Weekend 2 beta now finished, we need to see if you get one more chance to play before launch.

Is There Going to be More Battlefield 6 Betas?

The Battlefield 6 Comms page suggests that there will be no more Battlefield betas, and the next time you get to play BF6 is when the game comes out.

If you‚Äôve been playing the BF6 beta at any point, chances are you‚Äôve been keeping up with the Battlefield Comms X page. This has been a constant source of information since day one. From DLSS and DLAA updates to general bulletins on matchmaking, it has provided up-to-date details.

On August 18, it posted what appeared to be a farewell message on X for BF6 beta testing:

‚ÄúThank you all for playing throughout these Open Beta weekends. You made this truly special for us as you captured flags, controlled sectors, blew holes in buildings, charged into combat, nailed vehicles with RPGs, dove into fire to resurrect a teammate, sniped from different angles, pushed the line forward in tanks, and circled the battlefield in aerial combat. You truly showcased the huge variety of action-packed gameplay that is coming in Battlefield 6.

When Does Battlefield 6 Come Out?

Battlefield 6 is due for release on October 10, and this is likely the next time you get to play BF6.

Unless something catastrophic happens between now and October 10, I think it‚Äôs a case of waiting a while until the full launch, as there won‚Äôt be any more betas. Battlefield Labs testing lasted many weeks. Thousands of hours were accrued during the Open Betas, too. I would hazard a guess that Battlefield Studios has accumulated all the data and feedback it needs.

Servers Closing Down Soon The playlist options and game servers for Open Beta Weekend 2 will begin closing down in 1 hour at 12:00 UTC. Once the shut down starts, you‚Äôll be able to continue to play until your match ends. Thank you all for playing throughout these Open Beta

Did you get a chance to play any of the Battlefield 6 betas? What are your thoughts about the game ahead of its full-scale launch in October? I can‚Äôt wait, as we need a CoD alternative. Let me know what you think through the Insider Gaming forum.

IG has more Battlefield content for you. Read about the Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass, a BF6 datamine revealing larger maps and new Vehicles, and all Pre-Order bonuses explained.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Will Feature 16 6v6 Maps At Launch, It‚Äôs Claimed
item.content:encoded:
The latest Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 leak has revealed that 16 6v6 maps will be available at launch.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 leaks have been surfacing in large numbers recently, with several new details emerging over the past couple of days. We recently learned that the upcoming title will feature some remastered maps and also the return of specialist abilities. Now, we know how many 6v6 maps will be available at launch.

Black Ops 7 Will Feature 13 Original 6v6 Maps

The details about Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 6v6 maps come from a reliable COD leaker/insider, TheGhostOfHope. According to their recent post on X (formerly Twitter), 16 6v6 maps will be available at launch. Out of these, there are 13 original maps and three remastered ones from Black Ops 2.

Moreover, two maps will be available at launch for large-scale Skirmish, which features the leaked wingsuit mode. Lastly, players can expect ‚Äúplentiful‚Äù post-launch content. For comparison, Black Ops 6 had 12 6v6 maps at launch and 4 for Gunfight.

Black Ops 7 Co-Op Campaign Characters Leaked

Hope also provided players with a Black Ops 7 campaign leak yesterday, which revealed which characters will be available for 4-person co-op. These include David ‚ÄúSection‚Äù Mason, Mike Harper, Eric Samuels, and Chloe ‚ÄúKarma‚Äù Lynch. However, as the information about the Black Ops 7 campaign characters and the launch maps doesn‚Äôt come from an official source, readers should treat it with caution.

In other news, check out Insider Gaming‚Äôs exclusive report on Call of Duty: Black Ops 7‚Äôs campaign, which states it will merge with a 32-player mode on ‚ÄòAvalon‚Äô. Also, the game is set to release on November 14, 2025, and will reportedly not be available for the Switch 2 at launch. What are your thoughts on Black Ops 7 featuring 16 6v6 maps? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Battlefield 6‚Äôs latest datamine, which reveals larger maps and new vehicles. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass: All Exclusive BF6 Rewards & How to Get Them
item.content:encoded:
The Battlefield 6 Open Beta may be over, but there‚Äôs still work to be done to prepare for the release, with a fresh slew of exclusive rewards available to earn through the Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass.

Due to be released on October 10, Battlefield 6 is one of the most anticipated games of the year, which was proven by it taking just a few hours for over half a million concurrent players to assemble on Steam.

While it‚Äôs too late to earn the exclusive Battlefield 6 Open Beta rewards that were available, there‚Äôs now more loot to secure to bolster your locker before the game releases. Here are all the details.

All Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Rewards & How to Get Them

Six exclusive cosmetic bundles are available in the Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 pass, which will be immediately unlocked in Battlefield 6 on release.

The rewards are cosmetic items, so won‚Äôt provide any boost to you in gameplay, but are a decent way of showing your support to the Battlefield franchise and you can flex on other players in the lobby with items they won‚Äôt be able to get their hands on.

The Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass is available now and expires on October 7, just a few days before the release of Battlefield 6. In total, 30 exclusive rewards are available, as announced on X (formerly Twitter).

Check out all the exclusive rewards available in the pass in the table below.

What Other Rewards Are Available?

While the highlight of the pass is undoubtedly the exclusive rewards available to secure for Battlefield 6, there‚Äôs plenty more up for grabs with 60 free tiers and over 50 new rewards.

This includes a journey back in time through the Battlefield franchise, with rewards inspired by Battlefield 1, Battlefield Bad Company 2, Battlefield 3, and Battlefield 4.

There are still a few months to go until Battlefield 6 releases, so working through the Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass is a good way to kill time while you wait.

Are you planning on diving into Battlefield 2042 to unlock these exclusive Battlefield 6 rewards? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Battlefield, check out claims that the franchise is planning to become an annual release, and take a look at huge maps revealed in a Battlefield 6 datamine.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/battlefield-2042-road-to-battlefield-6-pass-all-exclusive-bf6-rewards-how-to-get-them/

item.title: Street Fighter Movie Photo Teases WWE Superstar Cody Rhodes as Guile
item.content:encoded:
The 2026 Street Fighter 6 movie is shaping up nicely. Cody Rhodes has been touted as one of the big-name stars set to light up the Street Fighter stage, and while it‚Äôs not official, we think we‚Äôve gotten an idea of how Guile could look, presumably, with Cody playing (and looking) the part.

It‚Äôs not uncommon for WWE superstars to transition from the hallowed grounds of the squared circle to the silver screen. The likes of Hulk Hogan, Andre the Giant, and Rowdy Roddy Piper famously paved the way. Dwayne ‚ÄòThe Rock‚Äô Johnson was the one to make the complete leap from professional wrestler to actor.

Others have followed suit‚Äîsuch as John Cena‚Äîand the new Street Fighter movie could catapult Cody Rhodes into greater superstardom.

First Cody Rhodes Teaser as Guile For 2026 Street Fighter Movie

Actor and comedian Andrew Schulz is playing Dan in the Street Fighter movie. They recently took to their personal Instagram page to share a story showing the shadow of someone sporting an iconic hairstyle‚ÄîGuile from Street Fighter.

Guile‚Äôs inverted shaven style is equal parts bizarre and legendary. I‚Äôve never tried to replicate it, and it‚Äôs not something I‚Äôm going to try‚Äîalthough it‚Äôs nothing a few cans of hairspray couldn‚Äôt sort.

Again, we‚Äôve not had official confirmation that Cody Rhodes is playing Guile. Eagle-eyed fans can infer this to be the case if they look at the song mentioned in the IG story. If you didn‚Äôt know, Kingdom by Downstait is Rhodes‚Äô famous theme song he‚Äôs used for years. Put 2 and 2 together, and I think we get the picture.

A teaser of Cody Rhodes as Guile on the set of the Street Fighter movie üëÄ (IG | andrewschulz)

The Street Fighter Movie cast also features more rumors and confirmed names, including Jason Momoa, 50 Cent, and fellow WWE star Roman Reigns.

Will the Street Fighter movie be a knockout? Or will it be a swing and a miss? Let me know through the Insider Gaming forum.

Check out more IG news, such as a Battlefield 6 Open Beta poll revealing the community‚Äôs favorite map and a petition calling for Roblox CEO‚Äôs to resign reaching 110,000 signatures in 10 days.
